Original: You must be more explorers taking up
the search for Yggdrasil. No problems
finding the Court, I trust?
[Page]
Welcome to Tharsis, the city closest
to Yggdrasil. I am its overseer; you
may call me the [Color:5]Outland Count[Color:0].
[Page]
Here in my Grand Court, when there are
important duties to be carried out, I
assign them to explorers as [Color:5]missions[Color:0].
[Page]
But of all the explorers who arrive in
Tharsis, like yourselves, we want only
the best on the hunt for Yggdrasil.
[Page]
Before you can set out on your search,
you must prove yourself worthy as
explorers. What say you to this?
Translation: You must be more explorers taking up
the search for Yggdrasil. No problems
finding the Court, I trust?
[Page]
Welcome to Tharsis, the city closest
to Yggdrasil. I am its overseer; you
may call me the [Color:5]Outland Count[Color:0].
[Page]
Here in my Grand Court, when there are
important duties to be carried out, I
assign them to explorers as [Color:5]missions[Color:0].
[Page]
But of all the explorers who arrive in
Tharsis, like yourselves, we want only
the best on the hunt for Yggdrasil.
[Page]
Before you can set out on your search,
you must prove yourself worthy as
explorers. What say you to this?

Original: [Color:5]How will you respond?[Color:0]
With annoyance
With acceptance
With silence
Translation: [Color:5]How will you respond?[Color:0]
With annoyance
With acceptance
With silence

Original: Ha! I like your fire. But as caretaker
of Tharsis, I cannot send unprepared
youths into severe danger.
[Page]
The fairest way to know whether you
can be trusted with this burden is to
see how you perform in a test.
[Page]
If you'll accept the [Color:5]mission[Color:0] I've
issued to new explorers, perhaps you
can back up your boasts with results.
Translation: Ha! I like your fire. But as caretaker
of Tharsis, I cannot send unprepared
youths into severe danger.
[Page]
The fairest way to know whether you
can be trusted with this burden is to
see how you perform in a test.
[Page]
If you'll accept the [Color:5]mission[Color:0] I've
issued to new explorers, perhaps you
can back up your boasts with results.

Original: Ah, very reasonable of you! In that
case, simply accept the [Color:5]mission[Color:0] I
have offered and prove your skills.
Translation: Ah, very reasonable of you! In that
case, simply accept the [Color:5]mission[Color:0] I
have offered and prove your skills.

Original: No answer, eh? Ha... very cautious of
you. An explorer must be prudent...
Is that the point you're making?
[Page]
Then simply accept the [Color:5]mission[Color:0] I have
issued and prove that your judgement
is sound even in a labyrinth.
Translation: No answer, eh? Ha... very cautious of
you. An explorer must be prudent...
Is that the point you're making?
[Page]
Then simply accept the [Color:5]mission[Color:0] I have
issued and prove that your judgement
is sound even in a labyrinth.

Original: Ah, hello. I'm sure you've heard, but
a red-furred monster was seen in the
lower reaches of the Lush Woodlands.
[Page]
It has claimed the lives of many of
our soldiers. Left unchecked, it may
prove a menace to you explorers, too.
[Page]
I've issued a mission to subjugate the
beast. It is the most dangerous task
I've requested, but it must be done.
[Page]
If you believe your skill to be up to
the challenge, then by all means,
accept the mission.
Translation: Ah, hello. I'm sure you've heard, but
a red-furred monster was seen in the
lower reaches of the Lush Woodlands.
[Page]
It has claimed the lives of many of
our soldiers. Left unchecked, it may
prove a menace to you explorers, too.
[Page]
I've issued a mission to subjugate the
beast. It is the most dangerous task
I've requested, but it must be done.
[Page]
If you believe your skill to be up to
the challenge, then by all means,
accept the mission.

Original: "I see... But this is incredible!"
The Count can barely restrain his
excitement at your report.
[Page]
"An entire unknown race, dwelling
deep within an unknown labyrinth...
Vessels, you called them?
[Page]
"And they are led by a young human
girl... Most interesting.
[Page]
"I'm intrigued by the account of
history this woman Wufan gave, but
it raises so many questions.
[Page]
"I'd like to ask you personally to
handle the mission, since you are
already involved... What say you?"
Translation: "I see... But this is incredible!"
The Count can barely restrain his
excitement at your report.
[Page]
"An entire unknown race, dwelling
deep within an unknown labyrinth...
Vessels, you called them?
[Page]
"And they are led by a young human
girl... Most interesting.
[Page]
"I'm intrigued by the account of
history this woman Wufan gave, but
it raises so many questions.
[Page]
"I'd like to ask you personally to
handle the mission, since you are
already involved... What say you?"

Original: So you've encountered yet another new
face... You make one amazing discovery
after another.
[Page]
But I worry about this illness you say
they suffer from. I see no reason not
to come to their aid.
[Page]
In fact, let's make it a mission.
Please accept it that we might
establish cordial relations.
Translation: So you've encountered yet another new
face... You make one amazing discovery
after another.
[Page]
But I worry about this illness you say
they suffer from. I see no reason not
to come to their aid.
[Page]
In fact, let's make it a mission.
Please accept it that we might
establish cordial relations.

Original: Ah, hello. How goes your pursuit of
the Medium?
[Page]
Hmm... an Empire and their fleet of
warships... Things are progressing in
an unexpected direction.
[Page]
I'd bet my Margherita that Whirlwind
is connected to that Empire. I'll
accept their parley offer, of course.
[Page]
Though I would like to ask you to
provide escort to the meeting point.
[Page]
I'll make a mission of it, in the
hopes that you'll accept.
Translation: Ah, hello. How goes your pursuit of
the Medium?
[Page]
Hmm... an Empire and their fleet of
warships... Things are progressing in
an unexpected direction.
[Page]
I'd bet my Margherita that Whirlwind
is connected to that Empire. I'll
accept their parley offer, of course.
[Page]
Though I would like to ask you to
provide escort to the meeting point.
[Page]
I'll make a mission of it, in the
hopes that you'll accept.

Original: Welcome back, Guild [Guild]. I see
everything went smoothly in acquiring
the [Color:6][Item:1458][Color:0].
[Page]
With that flame, you can ascend to
even greater heights. I'll notify the
wharf master to begin his work.
[Page]
Once that's done, I'd like for you to
head to the Echoing Library, rescue
the Medium, and stop the Empire.
[Page]
I needn't emphasize how important this
mission is to all of us. Accept it
only once you are thoroughly prepared.
Translation: Welcome back, Guild [Guild]. I see
everything went smoothly in acquiring
the [Color:6][Item:1458][Color:0].
[Page]
With that flame, you can ascend to
even greater heights. I'll notify the
wharf master to begin his work.
[Page]
Once that's done, I'd like for you to
head to the Echoing Library, rescue
the Medium, and stop the Empire.
[Page]
I needn't emphasize how important this
mission is to all of us. Accept it
only once you are thoroughly prepared.

Original: "To hear that such a dreadful monster
lurked in the Hall of Darkness is...
alarming," the Count sighs.
[Page]
"But this awful thing... its origins
must have been tied to the
[Enemy1:179]'s.
[Page]
"Had it been left alone, it would have
caused tremendous calamity when it
was eventually loosed.
[Page]
"You have saved us yet again. For your
meritorious service to Tharsis, Guild
[Guild], I present you with this."
Translation: "To hear that such a dreadful monster
lurked in the Hall of Darkness is...
alarming," the Count sighs.
[Page]
"But this awful thing... its origins
must have been tied to the
[Enemy1:179]'s.
[Page]
"Had it been left alone, it would have
caused tremendous calamity when it
was eventually loosed.
[Page]
"You have saved us yet again. For your
meritorious service to Tharsis, Guild
[Guild], I present you with this."

Original: "Oh? So you have finally filled all
the pages of your logbook. This feat
is, as far as I know, unprecedented."
[Page]
The white puppy in the Count's arms
barks enthusiastically.
[Page]
"Even Margherita is excited! I can't
think of praise high enough for what
you have accomplished here."
[Page]
The Count is reveling in your success
as much as if it had been his own.
[Page]
"I hope you realize what a momentous
achievement this is!
[Page]
"By the way... if it's all right
with you, may I have a look at this
wondrous logbook? What say you?"
Translation: "Oh? So you have finally filled all
the pages of your logbook. This feat
is, as far as I know, unprecedented."
[Page]
The white puppy in the Count's arms
barks enthusiastically.
[Page]
"Even Margherita is excited! I can't
think of praise high enough for what
you have accomplished here."
[Page]
The Count is reveling in your success
as much as if it had been his own.
[Page]
"I hope you realize what a momentous
achievement this is!
[Page]
"By the way... if it's all right
with you, may I have a look at this
wondrous logbook? What say you?"

Original: "How fare you today, Guild [Guild]?
[Page]
"If you have the time today, would you
allow me to page through that wondrous
logbook of yours...?"
Translation: "How fare you today, Guild [Guild]?
[Page]
"If you have the time today, would you
allow me to page through that wondrous
logbook of yours...?"

Original: [Color:5]Show your logbook to the Count?[Color:0]
Translation: [Color:5]Show your logbook to the Count?[Color:0]

Original: "Ah, excellent! Show me, starting with
the very first page. And don't skimp
on the commentary!"
Translation: "Ah, excellent! Show me, starting with
the very first page. And don't skimp
on the commentary!"

Original: The Count's eyes shine as you open the
logbook for him, and he breathes in
with wonder at the accrued knowledge.
Translation: The Count's eyes shine as you open the
logbook for him, and he breathes in
with wonder at the accrued knowledge.

Original: "Ah! Places to be, things to do, I
shouldn't wonder. Well, if you ever
have the time, I'm most eager to see."
Translation: "Ah! Places to be, things to do, I
shouldn't wonder. Well, if you ever
have the time, I'm most eager to see."

Original: As you are guided into the familiar
office, you are surprised by a feast
laid out on the table.
[Page]
"I've been expecting you, Guild
[Guild]." The Count's eyes shine
like those of a child.
[Page]
"I heard that you've slain a dreadful
monster in the depths of the Hall of
Darkness.
[Page]
"That awful thing... its origins must
have been tied to the [Enemy1:179]'s.
[Page]
"Had it been left alone, it would have
caused tremendous calamity when it
was eventually loosed.
[Page]
"You have saved us yet again. For your
meritorious service to Tharsis, Guild
[Guild], I present you with this."
Translation: As you are guided into the familiar
office, you are surprised by a feast
laid out on the table.
[Page]
"I've been expecting you, Guild
[Guild]." The Count's eyes shine
like those of a child.
[Page]
"I heard that you've slain a dreadful
monster in the depths of the Hall of
Darkness.
[Page]
"That awful thing... its origins must
have been tied to the [Enemy1:179]'s.
[Page]
"Had it been left alone, it would have
caused tremendous calamity when it
was eventually loosed.
[Page]
"You have saved us yet again. For your
meritorious service to Tharsis, Guild
[Guild], I present you with this."

Original: "But to have slain that ancient
monstrosity at its full strength...
How high will your power rise?
[Page]
"What must you do to gain such might?
I cannot imagine anyone who could be
your equal.
[Page]
"We are truly blessed to have
explorers of your caliber." The Count
exults in your feat as if it was his.
[Page]
"But enough chitchat! I had this
prepared quickly, so it may not be
much, but it's all yours!"
Translation: "But to have slain that ancient
monstrosity at its full strength...
How high will your power rise?
[Page]
"What must you do to gain such might?
I cannot imagine anyone who could be
your equal.
[Page]
"We are truly blessed to have
explorers of your caliber." The Count
exults in your feat as if it was his.
[Page]
"But enough chitchat! I had this
prepared quickly, so it may not be
much, but it's all yours!"

Original: As you are guided into the familiar
office, you are surprised by a feast
laid out on the table.
[Page]
"I've been expecting you, Guild
[Guild]." The Count's eyes shine
like those of a child.
[Page]
"I've heard that you defeated the
[Enemy1:180] again, and this
time, at its full strength!"
[Page]
"What must you do to gain such might?
I cannot imagine anyone who could be
your equal.
[Page]
"We are truly blessed to have
explorers of your caliber." The Count
exults in your feat as if it was his.
[Page]
"But enough chitchat! I had this
prepared quickly, so it may not be
much, but it's all yours!"
Translation: As you are guided into the familiar
office, you are surprised by a feast
laid out on the table.
[Page]
"I've been expecting you, Guild
[Guild]." The Count's eyes shine
like those of a child.
[Page]
"I've heard that you defeated the
[Enemy1:180] again, and this
time, at its full strength!"
[Page]
"What must you do to gain such might?
I cannot imagine anyone who could be
your equal.
[Page]
"We are truly blessed to have
explorers of your caliber." The Count
exults in your feat as if it was his.
[Page]
"But enough chitchat! I had this
prepared quickly, so it may not be
much, but it's all yours!"

Original: The Old Forest Mine is a small cave
located very near Tharsis.
[Page]
It's a wonderful place with lovely
vegetation, but since ore mining
halted, monsters have settled in.
[Page]
As it stands now, it makes an
excellent training ground for
novice explorers.
[Page]
Train hard against the monsters there
for the struggles to come!
Translation: The Old Forest Mine is a small cave
located very near Tharsis.
[Page]
It's a wonderful place with lovely
vegetation, but since ore mining
halted, monsters have settled in.
[Page]
As it stands now, it makes an
excellent training ground for
novice explorers.
[Page]
Train hard against the monsters there
for the struggles to come!

Original: Where are you all from? Goodness...
It must have taken you quite a while
to reach Tharsis.
[Page]
Well, while you are here in my city,
think of it as your own hometown.
Translation: Where are you all from? Goodness...
It must have taken you quite a while
to reach Tharsis.
[Page]
Well, while you are here in my city,
think of it as your own hometown.

Original: If you've been to the Lush Woodlands,
you may know, but there is a cloudy
ravine north of the Windy Plains.
[Page]
It is more dangerous than it looks.
Anyone who attempts to fly through it
loses their bearings and crashes.
[Page]
But it cannot be traversed over land
because of a deep fissure in the
ground along the way.
Translation: If you've been to the Lush Woodlands,
you may know, but there is a cloudy
ravine north of the Windy Plains.
[Page]
It is more dangerous than it looks.
Anyone who attempts to fly through it
loses their bearings and crashes.
[Page]
But it cannot be traversed over land
because of a deep fissure in the
ground along the way.

Original: Haven't I seen you talking with
Whirlwind once or twice?
[Page]
He may seem lighthearted, but do not
be fooled: he is decidedly one of
our top explorers.
[Page]
He also played an integral role in
the development of skyships. We owe
our livelihood in large part to him.
Translation: Haven't I seen you talking with
Whirlwind once or twice?
[Page]
He may seem lighthearted, but do not
be fooled: he is decidedly one of
our top explorers.
[Page]
He also played an integral role in
the development of skyships. We owe
our livelihood in large part to him.

Original: To explore a labyrinth is a battle
between man and the monsters which
dwell within.
[Page]
Man traverses the labyrinth in search
of its secret, while the monsters
jealously protect their habitat.
[Page]
It is a war that will not end unless
such exploration ceases... I ask that
you lend us your strength.
Translation: To explore a labyrinth is a battle
between man and the monsters which
dwell within.
[Page]
Man traverses the labyrinth in search
of its secret, while the monsters
jealously protect their habitat.
[Page]
It is a war that will not end unless
such exploration ceases... I ask that
you lend us your strength.

Original: That you have not only solved the Lush
Woodland's mystery, but blazed onward
to new skies... Truly magnificent!
[Page]
Keep at it, Guild [Guild]. As long
as you continue exploring, I will do
everything I can to accommodate you.
Translation: That you have not only solved the Lush
Woodland's mystery, but blazed onward
to new skies... Truly magnificent!
[Page]
Keep at it, Guild [Guild]. As long
as you continue exploring, I will do
everything I can to accommodate you.

Original: A new maze, called the Misty Ravine...
It's said that names and natures do
often agree, but I sense danger afoot.
[Page]
It's impossible to tell what sort of
threats may await you there. Make sure
you take precautions when braving it!
Translation: A new maze, called the Misty Ravine...
It's said that names and natures do
often agree, but I sense danger afoot.
[Page]
It's impossible to tell what sort of
threats may await you there. Make sure
you take precautions when braving it!

Original: My letter to the Vessels... I do not
think it was for naught.
[Page]
That letter will still be important
after you rescue the Medium.
[Page]
For now, devote all your efforts to
finding her. I am counting on you.
Translation: My letter to the Vessels... I do not
think it was for naught.
[Page]
That letter will still be important
after you rescue the Medium.
[Page]
For now, devote all your efforts to
finding her. I am counting on you.

Original: Whirlwind was by the other day. He was
grumbling about a bitter experience
he had fighting the Hollows.
[Page]
It's been so long since he started
visiting the Grand Court...
[Page]
He's interested in the oddest things.
In return for his help developing the
skyships, what do you think he wanted?
[Page]
A simple glass headpiece. I admit,
it was a family heirloom, so it was
not without its value...
[Page]
But what would an explorer want with
such a useless bauble? I'll never
understand that man.
Translation: Whirlwind was by the other day. He was
grumbling about a bitter experience
he had fighting the Hollows.
[Page]
It's been so long since he started
visiting the Grand Court...
[Page]
He's interested in the oddest things.
In return for his help developing the
skyships, what do you think he wanted?
[Page]
A simple glass headpiece. I admit,
it was a family heirloom, so it was
not without its value...
[Page]
But what would an explorer want with
such a useless bauble? I'll never
understand that man.

Original: Temperatures drop at higher altitudes,
so I can see why the region north of
the Scarlet Pillars is icebound.
[Page]
But the change in environment at the
Sacred Mountains seems rather extreme.
Is it natural, do you think?
Translation: Temperatures drop at higher altitudes,
so I can see why the region north of
the Scarlet Pillars is icebound.
[Page]
But the change in environment at the
Sacred Mountains seems rather extreme.
Is it natural, do you think?

Original: Aha... So you've discovered a new
maze with its own stone monument.
Well done, Guild [Guild]!
[Page]
But I'm curious as to why that
labyrinth's interior is so warm.
[Page]
Perhaps it sits in a region of heavy
volcanic activity, causing the
formation of natural hot springs...?
Translation: Aha... So you've discovered a new
maze with its own stone monument.
Well done, Guild [Guild]!
[Page]
But I'm curious as to why that
labyrinth's interior is so warm.
[Page]
Perhaps it sits in a region of heavy
volcanic activity, causing the
formation of natural hot springs...?

Original: First the Vessels, now the Sentinels!
The news you bring back from your
explorations never fails to surprise.
[Page]
I think this is another opportunity
to put the know-how you brought to
bear on the Vessels' problem to use.
[Page]
Which reminds me... I'm told that the
Medium is staying with the Sentinels
in their village now.
[Page]
It warms my heart to see everyone
working together to overcome
adversity. I am proud of you all.
Translation: First the Vessels, now the Sentinels!
The news you bring back from your
explorations never fails to surprise.
[Page]
I think this is another opportunity
to put the know-how you brought to
bear on the Vessels' problem to use.
[Page]
Which reminds me... I'm told that the
Medium is staying with the Sentinels
in their village now.
[Page]
It warms my heart to see everyone
working together to overcome
adversity. I am proud of you all.

Original: The legends of the Titan... To hear
the Sentinels tell it, they defeated
an evil Titan dwelling in Yggdrasil.
[Page]
It's a very different story than the
one told by the Vessels of a holy
tree. I hope we learn the truth soon.
Translation: The legends of the Titan... To hear
the Sentinels tell it, they defeated
an evil Titan dwelling in Yggdrasil.
[Page]
It's a very different story than the
one told by the Vessels of a holy
tree. I hope we learn the truth soon.

Original: Alas, the Empire... This is not how
I hoped our reunion with the builders
of the skyships would go.
[Page]
And Whirlwind! I couldn't believe my
ears when you told me he kidnapped
the Medium.
[Page]
I'm curious to know his motivations,
but whatever they are, the Medium
must be rescued.
Translation: Alas, the Empire... This is not how
I hoped our reunion with the builders
of the skyships would go.
[Page]
And Whirlwind! I couldn't believe my
ears when you told me he kidnapped
the Medium.
[Page]
I'm curious to know his motivations,
but whatever they are, the Medium
must be rescued.

Original: I hear that you have successfully
entered the Echoing Library where
the Medium is being held.
[Page]
Wiglaf and Kirjonen played their
parts well.
[Page]
I have asked them to remain on standby
in the Cloudy Stronghold until this
matter is concluded.
[Page]
Should you need to reenter the Echoing
Library via air, feel free to ask for
their cooperation again.
Translation: I hear that you have successfully
entered the Echoing Library where
the Medium is being held.
[Page]
Wiglaf and Kirjonen played their
parts well.
[Page]
I have asked them to remain on standby
in the Cloudy Stronghold until this
matter is concluded.
[Page]
Should you need to reenter the Echoing
Library via air, feel free to ask for
their cooperation again.

Original: The Imperial Prince most likely keeps
the Medium at his side always, no?
Would you say this is safe to assume?
[Page]
Who knows how the Imperial Prince may
have fortified his defenses...
[Page]
Breaking through will not be easy,
but I'm convinced you can do it.
Don't let us down, Guild [Guild].
Translation: The Imperial Prince most likely keeps
the Medium at his side always, no?
Would you say this is safe to assume?
[Page]
Who knows how the Imperial Prince may
have fortified his defenses...
[Page]
Breaking through will not be easy,
but I'm convinced you can do it.
Don't let us down, Guild [Guild].

Original: I cannot abide the actions the Empire
and Whirlwind have taken in this
matter.
[Page]
Still... I can sympathize with them.
They have been placed in an impossible
situation.
[Page]
Why must we, who share an ancestry,
fight each other like this...? Fate
can be cruel.
Translation: I cannot abide the actions the Empire
and Whirlwind have taken in this
matter.
[Page]
Still... I can sympathize with them.
They have been placed in an impossible
situation.
[Page]
Why must we, who share an ancestry,
fight each other like this...? Fate
can be cruel.

Original: The Empire has withdrawn its fleet. I
surmise the Imperial Prince ordered a
retreat at any change in Yggdrasil.
[Page]
After all, if Yggdrasil's power were
to be unleashed, any attempt to
escape it would be futile...
Translation: The Empire has withdrawn its fleet. I
surmise the Imperial Prince ordered a
retreat at any change in Yggdrasil.
[Page]
After all, if Yggdrasil's power were
to be unleashed, any attempt to
escape it would be futile...

Original: Ever since I was a boy, I've gazed at
Yggdrasil. It would be no exaggeration
to say it has always been with me.
[Page]
I assume the same is true for all
who live in Tharsis, not to mention
the Vessels and Sentinels...
[Page]
But this is no time to indulge in
sentiment. You must go to Yggdrasil's
roots and rescue the Medium.
Translation: Ever since I was a boy, I've gazed at
Yggdrasil. It would be no exaggeration
to say it has always been with me.
[Page]
I assume the same is true for all
who live in Tharsis, not to mention
the Vessels and Sentinels...
[Page]
But this is no time to indulge in
sentiment. You must go to Yggdrasil's
roots and rescue the Medium.

Original: I believe that the main labyrinths
and Yggdrasil are connected by
subterranean passages.
[Page]
They were originally one maze, but for
whatever reason, the passages were
sealed, leading to what we know now.
[Page]
Perhaps the people of old thought to
seal away Yggdrasil's power by closing
off the individual areas.
Translation: I believe that the main labyrinths
and Yggdrasil are connected by
subterranean passages.
[Page]
They were originally one maze, but for
whatever reason, the passages were
sealed, leading to what we know now.
[Page]
Perhaps the people of old thought to
seal away Yggdrasil's power by closing
off the individual areas.

Original: The Forgotten Capital... It does seem
to be a land of sorrow.
[Page]
The builders of Yggdrasil were only
trying to restore the golden age
they'd lost.
[Page]
Everything arose from their ideals
and hopes. Yet they were punished,
as if even wishing so was a sin.
[Page]
Now their descendants have taken up
their cause, leading to war...
It feels like a curse.
[Page]
I ask that you put an end to this war
with all at your disposal.
Translation: The Forgotten Capital... It does seem
to be a land of sorrow.
[Page]
The builders of Yggdrasil were only
trying to restore the golden age
they'd lost.
[Page]
Everything arose from their ideals
and hopes. Yet they were punished,
as if even wishing so was a sin.
[Page]
Now their descendants have taken up
their cause, leading to war...
It feels like a curse.
[Page]
I ask that you put an end to this war
with all at your disposal.

Original: That Titan as tall as the heavens is
beyond man's control... Normally,
that is.
[Page]
But then why does it remain immobile?
I believe the Medium is the cause.
[Page]
Her will alone prevents it from
wreaking havoc... Don't you agree?
[Page]
One more step, and this area too is
lost... But you can still make it in
time, as long as it is frozen.
[Page]
Go forth, Guild [Guild].
The Medium needs you.
Translation: That Titan as tall as the heavens is
beyond man's control... Normally,
that is.
[Page]
But then why does it remain immobile?
I believe the Medium is the cause.
[Page]
Her will alone prevents it from
wreaking havoc... Don't you agree?
[Page]
One more step, and this area too is
lost... But you can still make it in
time, as long as it is frozen.
[Page]
Go forth, Guild [Guild].
The Medium needs you.

Original: I must thank you again regarding that
unforeseen series of events.
[Page]
Though you did so at my request, you
stood firm against an immense enemy
and fought well.
[Page]
No matter the situation, you faced it
with wisdom and strength... I am proud
to call you explorers of Tharsis.
[Page]
Thank you, Guild [Guild].
Translation: I must thank you again regarding that
unforeseen series of events.
[Page]
Though you did so at my request, you
stood firm against an immense enemy
and fought well.
[Page]
No matter the situation, you faced it
with wisdom and strength... I am proud
to call you explorers of Tharsis.
[Page]
Thank you, Guild [Guild].

Original: The search for Yggdrasil is complete
for now. Yet life goes on...
[Page]
I've spoken with Imperial officials
in the Prince's stead. We are going
to take in the Empire's people.
[Page]
Not all at once! That would be folly.
But it must be done, no matter how
many decades it takes.
[Page]
And it would not be possible had you
not removed the barriers in the
ravines en route to Yggdrasil.
Translation: The search for Yggdrasil is complete
for now. Yet life goes on...
[Page]
I've spoken with Imperial officials
in the Prince's stead. We are going
to take in the Empire's people.
[Page]
Not all at once! That would be folly.
But it must be done, no matter how
many decades it takes.
[Page]
And it would not be possible had you
not removed the barriers in the
ravines en route to Yggdrasil.

Original: News of what happened here will soon
spread elsewhere. And that could pose
its own problems...
[Page]
My greatest worry is that it will
attract another who desires
Yggdrasil's power.
[Page]
Yes, I fear it will be inevitable
in the near future...
[Page]
I must take steps to prevent that
power from being used carelessly.
The last thing I want is another war.
Translation: News of what happened here will soon
spread elsewhere. And that could pose
its own problems...
[Page]
My greatest worry is that it will
attract another who desires
Yggdrasil's power.
[Page]
Yes, I fear it will be inevitable
in the near future...
[Page]
I must take steps to prevent that
power from being used carelessly.
The last thing I want is another war.

Original: This is just between you and I... but
I am thinking of handing the city over
to the Imperial Prince in the future.
[Page]
My wife has passed away, you see,
and I have no children to carry on
my legacy.
[Page]
And whenever I speak with that young
man, he demonstrates boundless
strength on behalf of his subjects.
[Page]
He can be cruel to his enemies, but if
his conception of his allies could be
expanded further...
[Page]
He may become a wise ruler, causing
not only his own country to flourish,
but nearby cities and nations as well.
[Page]
Though certainly, there are a mountain
of obstacles too! Either way, I'll see
how things play out for a while.
Translation: This is just between you and I... but
I am thinking of handing the city over
to the Imperial Prince in the future.
[Page]
My wife has passed away, you see,
and I have no children to carry on
my legacy.
[Page]
And whenever I speak with that young
man, he demonstrates boundless
strength on behalf of his subjects.
[Page]
He can be cruel to his enemies, but if
his conception of his allies could be
expanded further...
[Page]
He may become a wise ruler, causing
not only his own country to flourish,
but nearby cities and nations as well.
[Page]
Though certainly, there are a mountain
of obstacles too! Either way, I'll see
how things play out for a while.

Original: Fate is truly inscrutible. Ever since
your arrival, the atmosphere of
Tharsis has greatly changed.
[Page]
We've met the Vessels, the Sentinels,
and the Empire, and now all four of
us have healthy exchanges.
[Page]
Tharsis as it is now is a city of
miracles, where various races mingle.
And it was you who brought it about.
[Page]
I am ever so grateful. I ask that you
pray for the prosperity of our city
of miracles.
Translation: Fate is truly inscrutible. Ever since
your arrival, the atmosphere of
Tharsis has greatly changed.
[Page]
We've met the Vessels, the Sentinels,
and the Empire, and now all four of
us have healthy exchanges.
[Page]
Tharsis as it is now is a city of
miracles, where various races mingle.
And it was you who brought it about.
[Page]
I am ever so grateful. I ask that you
pray for the prosperity of our city
of miracles.
